Class VariationTests

Namespace
Pig.Tests
Assembly
Pig.Tests.dll

Contains regression tests for the various Pig game strategies. Validates that each implementation of IPigVariation correctly calculates scores and turn-state flags according to its specific rule set.

public class VariationTests

Methods

BigPig_DoubleOnes_ScoresTwentyFive()

Validates the Big Pig special case: Double ones are worth a fixed 25 points rather than wiping the score.

[Fact]
public void BigPig_DoubleOnes_ScoresTwentyFive()

BigPig_DoubleSixes_ScoresDoubleValue()

Validates the Big Pig bonus: Rolling doubles (excluding ones) should reward twice the sum of the dice and allow the turn to continue.

[Fact]
public void BigPig_DoubleSixes_ScoresDoubleValue()

Hog_AnyOneInBatch_ReturnsZero()

Validates the Hog rule: If any die in a multi-die throw is a '1', the entire throw scores zero and the turn ends.

[Fact]
public void Hog_AnyOneInBatch_ReturnsZero()

Hog_SuccessfulRoll_AddsPointsAndSwitchesPlayer()

Validates the Hog Single-Throw mechanic: A successful throw should automatically bank the points and advance the turn without requiring a separate 'Hold' action.

[Fact]
public void Hog_SuccessfulRoll_AddsPointsAndSwitchesPlayer()

StandardPig_RollingOne_EndsTurn()

Validates the Standard Pig rule: Rolling a single '1' results in zero points and ends the player's turn.

[Fact]
public void StandardPig_RollingOne_EndsTurn()

TwoDicePig_DoubleOnes_WipesTotalScore()

Validates the Two-Dice Pig "Snake Eyes" rule: Rolling two '1's results in the loss of the player's entire accumulated game score.

[Fact]
public void TwoDicePig_DoubleOnes_WipesTotalScore()
